title: Identifying the Font
content:
I’m having trouble identifying this font.  
Please Help...

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071207175922im_/http:/typophile.com/files/pier_6171.jpg)

 [‹ PHO Public Health Organisation Logo Font](http://web.archive.org/web/20071207175922/http:/typophile.com/node/39769 "Go to previous forum topic") [Curly Script - Christmas Hullabaloo ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071207175922/http:/typophile.com/node/39759 "Go to next forum topic")
author: pgdesigns

comments.content: Looks like good old Palatino with an altered A.

I use palatino all the time and I don’t think I’ve ever fully appreciated how truly odd that ’y’ is. It’s kind of like, “No sorry we don’t have that one in stock at the moment, but I might have something out the back you can use... just hang on a sec.”

That was fast. Thanks a bunch.

I have few more I was trying to identify. See if you can help me again.

This is for one of my projects

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071207175922im_/http:/typophile.com/files/jerry_6500.jpg)

I believe the Ben & Jerry’s font is custom.

See this thread  
 [http://typophile.com/node/3943](http://web.archive.org/web/20071207175922/http:/typophile.com/node/3943 "http://typophile.com/node/3943")

Hrant’s comment is truly hilarious.

I think you are right I read that somewhere before.

Quit whenever you think you have had enough of this.  
Another one coming along...

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071207175922im_/http:/typophile.com/files/mystic_3634.jpg)
That was a big help... thanks.
